Hartford Courant: 
Malloy charts smarter path for state https://t.co/y3ItmsSk7W
We are in this together. And together, we shall prevail. #CTSOTS
DM: Next month, I am going to come back to you with more details on the topics I laid out today. #CTSOTS
DM: Our prison population has dropped significantly, allowing us to save 70 million dollars in the current fiscal year. #CTSOTS
Connecticut is leading the nation and is safer than it has been in fifty years. #CTSOTS

After years of decline, our graduation rates have risen for 
five years in a row and are now at their highest point in Connecticut‚Äôs history
Unemployment is at 4.7 percent now at its lowest level since 2007. #CTSOTS
DM: Years of good economic development are helping to grow jobs. Since the end of the Great Recession, we have recovered 85,000 jobs #CTSOTS
The budget that I will present to you next month will outline a more equitable system for providing town aid.
Connecticut needs a new way to calculate educational aid‚Äî one that guarantees equal access to a quality education regardless of zip code.
DM: "It‚Äôs why I have long-advocated that we direct our support to those municipalities that are struggling the most" #CTSOTS
DM: I don‚Äôt believe we are meeting that standard. #CTSOTS
Are we ensuring that ALL students regardless of life circumstances or what town or city they live in can receive a quality public education?
DM: The question is whether, in a time of scarce state resources, are we spending this money in the best way possible? #CTSOTS
DM: Town aid, accounts for the largest portion of our state budget.  #CTSOTS

DM: 3rd and final area to focus on 
w you today is how we distribute aid to our towns and cities, primarily‚Äîhow we fund public education.
DM: As our past record demonstrates, when we come together, hold realistic expectations, and seek common ground, we can deliver results.
DM: My administration will continue meeting with labor leaders to explore how we can bring employee costs in line with our economic reality.

Is it frustrating to do that? 
Of course. 

Is it necessary?
Absolutely.
DM: "Simply put, our generation is paying for Connecticut‚Äôs past mistakes." #CTSOTS
DM: stark reality is that, after 80 years, the state has set aside less than half the money necessary to responsibly fund  its obligations.
DM: CT pension systems were created 80 years ago, but not a single dime was deposited into the account during the first 30 yrs of existence.
DM: The second area I‚Äôd like to talk about are the obligations we have to Connecticut‚Äôs state workers, educators, and retirees. #CTSOTS
DM: Agencies will continue to modernize systems, reduce waste, and increase productivity, in order to cut costs as much as possible...
DM: "Commissioners will need to once again work with their staff and with you, our legislative partners, to find additional savings" #CTSOTS
DM: "To start, we need to continue making state government leaner and more cost-effective." #CTSOTS
DM: "Today I‚Äôm going to discuss three key areas that I believe we should focus on this year" #CTSOTS
DM: ‚ÄúWe know that predictability creates confidence. And we know that confidence creates growth.‚Äù #CTSOTS
DM: ‚ÄúTogether we‚Äôve protected Connecticut‚Äôs aerospace and defense industries for a generation and likely beyond.‚Äù #CTSOTS
DM: ‚Äúit shored up thousands more jobs up and down Sikorsky‚Äôs supply chain, and across every corner of our great state.‚Äù #CTSOTS
DM: ‚ÄúThe legislation you voted to support, and that I signed into law, protected 8,000 jobs at Sikorsky Aircraft.‚Äù #CTSOTS
DM: This past September the CGA Assembly met in a special session to take historic action in support of state‚Äôs economy & workforce.
DM: ‚ÄúAnd finally thank you to my wife Cathy and our three sons for their love and support.‚Äù #CTSOTS
DM: ‚ÄúThank you, as well, to my dear friend and the best Lt. Governor in the country, @LGWyman.‚Äù #CTSOTS
DM: ‚ÄúAs always, let us thank Connecticut's brave men and women serving our nation around the globe.‚Äù #CTSOTS
DM: ‚Äúsince we were here last together we have lost some dear friends, including Mary Fritz and Betty Boukus‚Äù  #CTSOTS
DM: "Let me offer my sincere congratulations to those of you taking on new and important leadership roles." #CTSOTS
